snippet: Angry calls for resistance in the wake of three deaths placed a new spotlight on a planned visit to the region by Secretary of State John Kerry.
abstract: Anger continues to flare across West Bank as Palestinians bury two teenagers killed by Israeli soldiers during protests triggered by death of prisoner while in Israeli custody; rising tension puts pressure on impending visit to region by Sec of State John Kerry to aid in jump-starting peace process.

byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and ISABEL KERSHNER
byline.contributor: Khaled Abu Aker contributed reporting from Ramallah, West Bank, and Nayef Hashlamoun from Hebron, West Bank.

lead_paragraph: Angry calls for resistance in the wake of three deaths placed a new spotlight on a planned visit to the region by Secretary of State John Kerry.

headline.seo: West Bank Funerals Become Displays of Defiance
headline.main: Palestinian Defiance on Display at West Bank Funerals
headline.print_headline: Palestinian Defiance on Display at West Bank Funerals
